definition: to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.english: Field Marshal Keitel described her appearance during an interrogation at Nuremberg.
sentences.chinese: 在纽伦堡一次提审时，凯特尔元帅描述了她的形象。

sentences.english: Arraignment is when the charges against the juvenile will be read, and the judge will ask how the juvenile pleads.
sentences.chinese: 提审会宣读对其的指控，法官会要求他自己进行抗辩。

sentences.english: Three white dress uniform pseudo into a concentration camp, he took out the arraignment.
sentences.chinese: 白三穿着伪军装进了集中营，他拿出提审令。

sentences.english: His arraignment is scheduled for later today.
sentences.chinese: 他将于今天晚些时候被提审。

sentences.english: Castro was to be arraigned today, and is to face a capital murder charge.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯特罗是今天被提审，并面临死刑的谋杀罪指控。

sentences.english: Right by his conviction death left a few less, she would Chang Fu remand the case.
sentences.chinese: 右少想通过翻案搞死左少，她要提审常福。

sentences.english: The accessory before the fact was brought to court for trial this morning.
sentences.chinese: 那名事前从犯今天上午被提审。

sentences.english: Breivik has been charged with terrorism and will be arraigned on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 布雷维克被指控犯有恐怖袭击罪并将于周一提审。

definition: to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
in custody/to keep sb in detention
to re-investigate/to investigate and reconsider a judgment
to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
